bioghist.p: The Male Adult Association of Philadelphia changed its name to the Auxiliary Evangelical Society in 1817. The object of the Society was to "teach adult males to read, to excite them to the study of the Holy scriptures -- this object being accomplished, writing, arithmetic may be attended to at the discretion of the association."

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Auxiliary Evangelical Society. The collection is primarily comprised of minutes and related records, 1815-1822. The monthly minutes includes constitution and by-laws, resolutions, committee reports, and some financial information related to the purchase of supplies.
